qas.question: What is one of BYU's characteristics that is most often pointed out through reputation?
What percentage of BYU's class of 2005 were married?
What is the national marriage average among college graduates?
What is the average age that BYU students marry according to a 2005 study?
What type of marriage is highly valued by LDS members?
What does BUY have a reputation for?
What percentage of BYU's class of 2015 are married?
Men do what at the average age of 27?
Women do what at the average age of 25?

context: One of the characteristics of BYU most often pointed out is its reputation for <a0_0><b5_0>emphasizing a "marriage culture"<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints highly value marriage and family, especially <a4_0>marriage within the faith<a4_0/>. <a1_0>Approximately <b6_0>51<a1_0/> percent<b6_0/> of the graduates in BYU's class of 2005 were married. This is compared to a national marriage average among college graduates of <a2_0>11 percent<a2_0/>. BYU students on average <b7_0><b8_0>marry<b8_0/><b7_0/> at the age of <a3_0>22<a3_0/>, according to a 2005 study, while the national average age is 25 years for men and 27 years for women.
